oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Interviews Jimmy Dean - Parts 1, 2 and 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Jimmy Dean (performer) for the Ralph Emery Show. Tape labeled parts 1, 2 and 3. Recording is from an unknown date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Jimmy Dean
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Ralph Emery discusses with Jimmy Dean his upcoming radio spot -- (00:11) Dean radio spot introducing the New Year's episode of the Ralph Emery Show -- (00:26) Emery discusses with Jimmy Dean his upcoming radio spot -- (00:43) Emery introduces Dean, and Dean does an impression -- (02:42) Emery asks Dean about his long career, and both reflect on Dean's diminished amount of work -- (04:59) Emery inquires about Dean's marriage and invites Dean to sing "Bummin' Around" -- (06:15) Dean jokes about using a cleat on Crystal Gayle -- (06:37) Emery and Dean discuss how Dean met Ronnie Milsap; additionally, Dean praises the longevity of the Statler Brothers -- (09:19) Dean asks for a tissue, and Emery and Dean joke about Dean's sinus issues -- (10:04) Emery introduces T. G. Sheppard, and Dean expresses his displeasure with artists spending their money -- (11:35) Dean reveals he wrote "Big Bad John" while on a plane based on actor John Minto -- (14:26) Emery inquires what song Dean would like played at his funeral -- (15:10) Emery jokingly introduces Lee Greenwood's "You've Got a Good Love Comin'" -- (15:30) Dean reveals that Ernie Ford called Dean to give a Big John statue -- (16:27) Emery invites Dean to discuss his time in the air force as a radio operator/mechanic -- (18:58) Dean and Emery praise Patsy Cline and Reba McEntire while introducing "How Blue" -- (19:56) Emery inquires about Dean's sentimental nature while discussing "Farmer and the Lord" -- (23:18) Emery and Dean radio spot outro for K-Mart and Jimmy Dean Sausage -- (23:57) Emery and Dean joke about Dean having a hangover -- (25:48) Dean calls "To a Sleeping Beauty" one of his favorite tracks; additionally, that he wrote it for his daughter, Connie Dean -- (29:14) Dean praises the Kendalls, and Emery invites Dean to recall his story about a man driving excessively fast -- (31:39) Dean expresses his love of Eddy Arnold's humor, and Emery addresses Arnold's humor styling -- (32:49) Emery inquires about how Jimmy Dean faced the bureaucracy of the Sausage business -- (36:55) Emery questions if Dean does not know what Sam Hill is; additionally, both discuss the truths about learning slang -- (40:04) Emery introduces Dean to Eddy Raven, and Dean reveals the Oak Ridge Boys were his backup when they introduced the "Y'all Come Back Saloon" -- (42:15) Emery and Dean joke about Dean's hosting style before Emery telling how Dolly Parton changed his smoking habit -- (43:55) Emery inquires as to why Dean chose to record with Dottie West and his preference to "Slowly" -- (44:48) Emery and Dean joke during their outros -- (45:27) Emery and Dean joke post show -- (45:46) Emery greets Dean, and Dean jokes about the dishonest nature of Emery's greeting -- (46:56) Emery invites Dean to discuss his mother's influence while introducing "I Owe You" -- (50:16) Emery insists that Dean's "A Thing Called Love" with Jerry Reed and Chet Atkins almost starts like "Big Bad John" -- (51:32) Emery invites Dean to introduce Charley Pride, and Dean reveals he is a member of a sausage business -- (52:20) Emery inquires about Dean's desire to see the 'little guy' win when writing "Frilly Shirt" -- (54:15) Emery tells a story about how the Maddox Brothers' mother went to a Cadillac dealership in poor clothing -- (55:58) Dean expresses his trust in Emery while he introduces Exile -- (56:22) Emery reveals how Emmylou Harris came from Washington D. C. -- (57:50) Emery inquires about Dean's knowledge of new talent -- (58:52) Emery and Dean discuss Dean's children, and Emery invites Dean to sing "Sweet Georgia Brown" -- (1:00:36) Emery and Dean perform their commercial outros, and Emery says goodbye
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Dean, Jimmy; Dean, Jimmy, 1928-2010;
